input_sentence: if Ego vehicle in front of other vehicle then it must not brake suddenly without a compelling reason.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego vehicle is in front of other vehicle
There is a compelling reason for braking

temporal_relations.description: If ego in front of other and no compelling reason exists, then ego must not brake suddenly

lexicon.ego_in_front: Ego vehicle is in front of other vehicle
lexicon.has_reason: There is a compelling reason for braking

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: in_front_of(ego,other) [relational predicate with two objects]
   - ap_2: sudden_braking(ego) [unary predicate with single object]
   - ap_3: compelling_reason(ego) [unary predicate with single object]

3. Map temporal relation "ap_1 & ~ap_3 -> ~ap_2" to predicate form:
   - in_front_of(ego,other) & ~compelling_reason(ego) -> ~sudden_braking(ego)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G (in_front_of(ego,other) & ~compelling_reason(ego) -> ~sudden_braking(ego))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: in_front_of(ego,other) [relational predicate with two objects]
   - ap_2: sudden_braking(ego) [unary predicate with single object]
   - ap_3: compelling_reason(ego) [unary predicate with single object]

3. Map temporal relation "ap_1 & ~ap_3 -> ~ap_2" to predicate form:
   - in_front_of(ego,other) & ~compelling_reason(ego) -> ~sudden_braking(ego)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula uses the global operator `G`, meaning the condition must hold at all times
- The antecedent contains a conjunction (`&`) of two predicates: 
  - `in_front_of(ego,other)` is a relational predicate meaning "ego vehicle is in front of other vehicle"
  - `~compelling_reason(ego)` is a negated unary predicate meaning "there is no compelling reason for ego vehicle to brake"
- The consequent is `~sudden_braking(ego)`, a negated unary predicate meaning "ego vehicle does not brake suddenly"
- The implication (`->`) structure indicates a conditional relationship: if the conditions in the antecedent are true, then the consequent must be true
- All objects are preserved: "ego vehicle" and "other vehicle" are explicitly referenced

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is in front of another vehicle and there is no compelling reason for the ego vehicle to brake, then the ego vehicle must not brake suddenly.

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
